lines.text: They tell me you killed Ferraro. How did it feel?
He didn't say.
fools get away with the impossible.
That's because they're the only ones who try it.
What about tomorrow morning?
All right, what about it?
The hunting. I've got all the equipment you need. How about me rootin' you out about five.
Five?
He shoots them as they crawl out of bed.
Do you mind if I join you?
Seems you have.
She is beautiful as well as interesting, isn't she?
She's beautiful - that's always interesting.
I'm too young to die. How about you?
Too well-known.
Well, if you do get killed, I'll make sure you get a first-rate funeral in Hollywood, at Grauman's Chinese Theatre.
I've already had it. My last picture died there.
[Saying goodbye]
I'll see ya all of a sudden, Sam.
If you used that needle to sew, you'd be a much happier woman.
I'm out of my mind to ask her... She hates everything I do.
She likes you.
Yeh, I know, that's what I don't understand.
If she liked me, man, I wouldn't try to understand.
You are not a pig. You are what a pig becomes. It is sometimes eaten between two pieces of bread.
Whenever I have nothing to do and I can't think, I always iron my money.
What d'ya do when you're broke?
When I'm broke, I press my pants.
Wherever I am, I sing at the drop of a hat.
Even if you have to supply the hat?
Exactly!
Put the gun down now. The guy behind you has a bigger one.
Let's keep it nice and polite, huh? Have him introduce himself.

[to a self-proclaimed heiress]
I haven't met as many rich dames as I'd like to, but I know one thing - they all have a terror of talking about their dough.
Alas, why must I be plagued by yammering magpies on the eve of battle?
This place is dangerous. The time right deadly. The drinks are on me, my bucko!

[to a dame]
You know, you could be a handy thing to have around the house if a man went broke.

[preparing to lash Dan Milner]
Take off his shirt. Stand him over there.

[speaking of Dan Milner]
I want him to be fully conscious. I don't like to shoot a corpse. I want to see the expression on his face when he knows it's coming.
American language I know well, but the use to which Americans put it, I'm not always able to understand.

that was one of the finest movies I've ever seen. They oughta' make 'em ALL like that. None of this nonsense about social matters. People don't go to the movies to see how miserable the world is - they go there to eat popcorn and be happy!

[Addressing Mr. Krafft]
What did you think of it?

[Dourly]
It had a message no pigeon would carry.

[Slightly amused, turning to Mr. Winton]
At my studios, all messages are handled by Western Union.
he's an *intellectual.*
[Cardigan responds with a look of mild alarm]

[to Milner and Lenore]
Well, what did you think of the picture?

[Sarcasm]
Oh, it was fine. It was just a little long - about an hour and a half.

[to a musician who has recognized her from her "previous" life]
Liz Brady went to Europe with a USO troupe. She never came back.
Where have you been? I looked for you all day.
I stayed in bed. "Nimrod" went hunting again.

[Preparing to go out and rescue Dan Milner]
Now might I drink hot blood and do such bitter business the earth would quake to look upon.

[Rolling eyes]
'Hamlet' again...
Mark, this is no time for histrionics.

[Scoffing]
What fools ye mortals be.
Mark... you're wounded!
'Tis not so deep as a well, nor so wide as a church door.
This is man's work. Women are for weeping.

[the rescue boat he was "commanding" has sunk beneath him]
Now would I give a thousand furlongs of sea for an acre of barren ground.
I must rid all the seas of pirates.
Are you in the oil business, or are you just spending your alimony all at once?
I'm what you'd call a spoiled child of the rich.
Well, how do you do? I'm what you'd call a spoiled child of the poor.

You know, this is the most wonderful place in the whole world. You should see the buck I killed yesterday. You'll see the pictures as soon as Morro gets them in his album. He's makin' a scrapbook of everything I kill!
Yes, he mentioned it. He also said that, given the time and ammunition, you might very well rid the world of all animal life.
